intro: Hedyotis papafranciscoi, commonly known as the Paphuan flame vine, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red to orange flowers, which are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
